summary: "The Truman Show" (1998) is an American movie about Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey), who lives his life on a massive TV set without knowing it. Everyone he knows is an actor, and his whole life is a reality TV show watched worldwide. The film, directed by Peter Weir, was a hit and received critical acclaim. It explores ideas about reality, privacy, and surveillance. Most of the filming happened in Seaside, Florida. The movie cost $60 million to make and made over $264 million worldwide.
title: The Truman Show
